title: Flipped Learning-Based Educational Course for Understanding ADHD

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic psychology and pedagogy
context.additional_context: Theory-practice integrated learning for ADHD in a smartphone-centric limited technological environment, with flipped learning involving pre-learning followed by discussions and projects

learning_goals: Learners will be able to explain ADHD diagnostic criteria and major symptoms with 90% accuracy.
Participants will be able to design and present at least three customized educational strategies for students with ADHD.
Learners will structure a debate on ethical issues related to ADHD (e.g., medication, stigma) with both supporting and opposing arguments.
Participants will complete an educational project incorporating peer feedback using flipped learning materials.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
